findings.claim: A group is a set G combined with an operation that satisfies closure, associativity, identity element, and inverse element.
findings.explanation: The definition provided matches the standard definition of a group in group theory.

findings.claim: The set of integers under addition, (Z, +), is a group.
findings.explanation: It is well-established that the integers under addition form a group.

findings.claim: The set of non-zero rational numbers under multiplication, (Q*, ·), is a group.
findings.explanation: The set of non-zero rational numbers under multiplication satisfies the group properties.

findings.claim: The set of permutations of a finite set forms a group known as the symmetric group.
findings.explanation: The claim correctly identifies the symmetric group as the group formed by permutations of a finite set.
